# Cohen's $d$

Cohen's d

Guidelines (short reference [@Cohen1992], book: [@Cohen1988])
small: 0.20
medium: 0.50
large: 0.80


Guidelines for education research Lipsey et al. 2012 (add this)



```{r comp-cohensd}
# All of the following works only if the first mean = 0 and sd = 1 for all
cohens_d <- c(0.2, 0.5, 0.8, 1.1, 1.5, 2.0)

for (i in seq_along(cohens_d)) {
  # create plot
  tmp_plot <- ggplot() +
    stat_function(fun = dnorm, args = list(mean = 0, sd = 1), 
                  geom = "area", fill = 2, alpha = 0.5) +
    stat_function(fun = dnorm, args = list(mean = cohens_d[[i]], sd = 1),
                  geom = "area", fill = 3, alpha = 0.5) +
    xlim(c(-5, 5)) +
    labs(title = bquote("Cohen's"~italic(d)~"="~.(cohens_d[[i]])))
  # save plot to object
  assign(str_c("d", i), tmp_plot)
}

# Output plots
d1 + d2 + d3 + d4 + d5 + d6


```
